text: What's the best way to sponsor Julia? The Github sponsor option is convenient and has some visibility, but I suspect there may be more efficient means such as going through a 501(c)(3) like NumFocus.

elements.text: What's the best way to sponsor Julia? The Github sponsor option is convenient and has some visibility, but I suspect there may be more efficient means such as going through a 501(c)(3) like NumFocus.

text: > Funds are collected and disbursed via NumFOCUS, a 501(c)(3) public charity in the United States, which acts as the fiscal sponsor for the project.

elements.text: Funds are collected and disbursed via NumFOCUS, a 501(c)(3) public charity in the United States, which acts as the fiscal sponsor for the project.

attachments.title: Donate to Julia!
attachments.text: I just donated to Julia! Join me and give back to the open source projects we love. Your generous gift helps advance the NumFOCUS mission to promote open practices in research, data, and scientific computing.

text: I suspect if you need a certificate for tax reasons

elements.text: I suspect if you need a certificate for tax reasons

text: you have to go directly through NF

elements.text: you have to go directly through NF

text: Is there less friction if I sponsor through NumFocus directly in terms of payment processing? Does Github take a cut?

elements.text: Is there less friction if I sponsor through NumFocus directly in terms of payment processing? Does Github take a cut?

text: > GitHub Sponsors does not charge any fees for sponsorships from user accounts, so 100% of these sponsorships go to the sponsored developer or organization. The 10% fee for sponsorships from organizations is waived during the beta. For more information, see "About billing for GitHub Sponsors."

elements.text: GitHub Sponsors does not charge any fees for sponsorships from user accounts, so 100% of these sponsorships go to the sponsored developer or organization. The 10% fee for sponsorships from organizations is waived during the beta. For more information, see "About billing for GitHub Sponsors."

text: Translation: They will charge 10% in the future.

elements.text: Translation: They will charge 10% in the future.

text: Yes. Going direct to Numfocs gives you the option to pay the payment processor charge

elements.text: Yes. Going direct to Numfocs gives you the option to pay the payment processor charge

text: That said I think there is some value in showing people sponsoring Julia on Github.

elements.text: That said I think there is some value in showing people sponsoring Julia on Github.

text: but I suspect <@U679VPJ8L> might be better equiped to answer these questions

elements.text: might be better equiped to answer these questions

text: The Github sponsor button is the most convenient, so use that as the default. The money comes into our NumFOCUS account. All julia finances are handled by Numfocus. If you need a tax certificate, then you need to pay Numfocus directly. Ask me for bank details, or mail a check.

elements.text: The Github sponsor button is the most convenient, so use that as the default. The money comes into our NumFOCUS account. All julia finances are handled by Numfocus. If you need a tax certificate, then you need to pay Numfocus directly. Ask me for bank details, or mail a check.

text: No, we don't have that much money yet

elements.text: No, we don't have that much money yet

text: All that money BigJulia spends on bot armies in hackernews PR could go into cloning Kenos. Think of the codebase! The PRs!

elements.text: All that money BigJulia spends on bot armies in hackernews PR could go into cloning Kenos. Think of the codebase! The PRs!
